New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers ended Oklahoma Cityâ€™s 15-game winning streak, improving their league-best record to 32-4 and extending their home winning streak to 19-1.
The game marked the third time in history where the top two teams in the NBA met with double-digit winning streaks, last seen in 1995.
Key Match Events: With Cleveland up 125-122, a loose ball foul was called against Donovan Mitchell, but it was reversed after replay review. Evan Mobley then made a crucial 10-footer to extend the lead to five points.
Pre-Game Insights: The game had the intensity of a Finals matchup, with 30 lead changes and neither team leading by more than nine points.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavaliers showed their balance and depth, especially with Donovan Mitchell scoring just 11 points on 3 of 16 shooting.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was significant for the Cavaliers' strong performance at home and their ability to win despite Mitchell's off-night.
Others: The Thunder's Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 31 points, and Jalen Williams added 25, but the Cavs' balanced effort led to the victory.
